page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY OF SYDMONTON
page.content: THERE ARE TUMULI IN THIS AREA ON THE TOPS OF THE DOWNS, PROBABLY CONNECTED WITH A NEARBY FORT. WHEN THE CAR PARK AT WHITE HILL WAS EXCAVATED, MANY SKELETONS WERE FOUND, AGAIN THOUGHT TO BE CONNECTED WITH A NEIGHBOURING ANCIENT SETTLEMENT. THE AREA AROUND FIELD BARN FARM HAS MUCH HISTORICAL INTEREST. CANNON BALLS HAVE BEEN FOUND IN THE FIELD NORTH OF THE FARM. THESE ARE THOUGHT TO BE THE RESULT OF TEST FIRING FROM A FARM 1 MILE TO THE NORTH DURING THE BATTLE OF NEWBURY IN THE 17th CENTURY & HAVE GIVEN THEIR NAME TO NEARBY DOWNLAND. THE FIELDS WEST OF THE FARM WERE USED AS A NAVAL RANGE DURING THE 2nd WORLD WAR. THE STRAIGHT TRACK MARKED NORTH-SOUTH ON THE MAP SHOWS THE POSITION OF A FORMER RAILWAY WHICH WAS USED TO RETRIEVE SHELLS FIRED UP INTO A CHALK PIT ON THE EDGE OF CANNON HEATH DOWN.
